title: Meeker 2014 Hoskins Ranch Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)
description: A rare 100% varietal offering, this works well to showcase dusty, pronounced tannin around a richness of baked cherry and strawberry seasoned in white pepper and orange. Tart acidity works alongside floral aromatics of cherry blossom and violet.

title: Merry Edwards 2015 Coopersmith Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Rose, hibiscus and pistachio mark the aromatic profile of this hearty, well-made wine, dipping into juicy, succulent and bright layers of blueberry and black cherry. A round rich tannin structure provides a welcome fleshiness, with a backbone of acidity.

title: Michel & Stéphane Ogier 2013 Les Vieilles Vignes  (Condrieu)
description: Four years after bottling, the vibrance of Viognier's characteristic honeysuckle and tropical fruit are waning here, but a fascinating transformation of earth, nut and spice is taking place. Full bodied and concentrated, the palate offers muted, dustier flavors of dried orange peel and apple shaded with hints of dried herb and bramble.

title: Mommessin 2016 Les Grandes Mises  (Saint-Amour)
description: A selection of grapes from different parcels lies behind this wine. With its dense texture contrasted with crisp acidity, it is fruity and has a dry core. Aged on its lees, the wine has a chewy character that will need to soften. Drink from late 2018.

title: Omen 2015 Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)
description: Blackberry and dark-chocolate flavors push through a firm and tannic texture in this medium to full-bodied wine from a new brand and a French-born winemaker. It's distinctively lean in mouthfeel due to substantive tannin content, but in the aromas and on the finish, an abundance of berries and dark spices comes through.

title: Ousterhout 2015 Bucher Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is made in a light nuanced style, and is somewhat shy at first on the nose. Perfumed rose eventually comes through to accent welcoming, bright flavors of orange and red cherry. The oak is tight-grained and supportive.

title: Oveja Negra 2014 Single Vineyard Carignan (Maule Valley)
description: Oaky black-fruit aromas come with notes of maple and molasses. A dry, tannic palate is braced by lively acidity, while this tastes of tomato sauce, plum and oak. Chewy tannins are at the foundation of a big finish.

title: Patland 2014 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: A hearty blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec and Syrah, given plenty of time in new French oak, this wine is a mix of crayon wax, red and black currant and firm, grasping tannin structure. Complex, it adds secondary characteristics of black cherry and lightly oaked spice as it opens in the glass, full bodied all along.

title: Pear Valley 2014 Inspiration Red (Paso Robles)
description: Elegant aromas of violet and lilac meet with an intense and pure expression of boysenberry jam on the nose of this blend of 45% Mourvèdre, 34% Syrah and 21% Grenache. The palate is framed by a strong tannic backbone and a plush mouthfeel that carries flavors of black plum, boysenberry and, on the finish, a flash of vanilla.

title: Pono 2014 Mana Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A small-production wine from a brand-new producer, this is blended with 10% Merlot and 2% Petit Verdot. Simply structured with grace and restrained tannin, it's highlighted in black cherry, vanilla and a hearty streak of cinnamon, presenting full-bodied power from an elegant perspective.

title: Raphael 2014 Reserve Petit Verdot (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Loads of coffee and toasted coconut aromas currently veil the dense, dark fruit that lies beneath. A rich, inky palate of plum and dark cherry shows warming notes of espresso grounds and cocoa nibs. With it's big, broad structure and balanced acidity to boot, this young wine should start to integrate well in a few years' time. Drink from 2020.

title: Sanguis 2014 Acacia Thorns Red (Central Coast)
description: This is a dense bottling that combines Petite Sirah and Petit Verdot, so dense that the brooding nature hides many of the aromas and flavors. But patience eventually rewards with black-plum skins, tree bark and earth on the nose, and black currant and chalky tannins on the palate.

title: Schwarzböck 2016 Aichleiten Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)
description: Lovely and appetizing notes of green and yellow pear play on the nose of this wine. The palate adds a bright lemon highlight to these aromas, keeping it sprightly but also juicy and ripe. The finish has a lovely lemony tang.

title: Sean Minor 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: A rose petal aroma starts things off in this wine, while the palate provides a delicate rendering of rhubarb, strawberry and forest floor flavors, buoyed by a gravelly texture and balanced ripeness.

title: Silverpoint Cellars 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Don Van Staaveren is the winemaker of this well-crafted wine, sourced from Rodger's Creek Vineyard in the Petaluma Gap area. Opulent on the nose, it follows up in richness and robust flavors of toasted oak and apple, finishing awash in butterscotch.

title: Spier 2015 Vintage Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Coastal Region)
description: This is a very enticing pour, with vibrant herbal streaks of tobacco, leather and dried fynbos that grace the dark fruit core. The medium-weight palate offers a velvety texture and layers of ripe blackberry and cassis flavors. Earthy hits of turned earth and cigar-box spice grace the lingering finish. Drink now–2021.

title: Stift Klosterneuburg 2015 Reserve St. Laurent (Thermenregion)
description: Creamy vanilla of oak completely dominates the nose. The palate skates on that same, smooth creaminess with its rich, mellow and generous notes of ripe, red cherry. The finish is velvety, ripe and rounded.

title: Te Mata 2014 Bullnose Syrah (Hawke's Bay)
description: Still a baby, this Hawke's Bay Syrah should develop into a lovely drop. For now, it's dense with drying oak spice, cola, red and black berries, dried herbs and a hint of smoke. The oak is apparent on the palate but there's also plenty of juicy fruit and acidity to keep things in check. Drink 2020–2027.

title: Tenuta di Lilliano 2014 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: Made with 90% Sangiovese, 5% Colorino and 5% Merlot, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, leather and a touch of eucalyptus. The firm palate delivers red plum, black cherry, tobacco and clove alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2026.

title: Tenuta di Lilliano 2015  Chianti Classico
description: Aromas of violet, red-skinned berry and mint lead the way. The bright palate doles out black cherry, white pepper and a hint of nutmeg alongside velvety tannins and fresh acidity. Enjoy through 2024.

title: Tenuta di Nozzole 2013 La Forra Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Black-skinned berry, leather and white pepper aromas are at the forefront while the concentrated palate offers ripe black cherry, tobacco and a touch of star anise. Firm, polished tannins provide support. Enjoy through 2024.

title: The Farm Winery 2014 Touchy-Feely Grenache-Syrah (Adelaida District)
description: Candied strawberry fruit meets with the lightest hint of sage on the nose of this bottling, which includes 18% Syrah. Rounded red fruits show on the sip with a pinch of dried garden herbs, set against a structure that's well balanced between acidity and tannins.

title: Tortoise Creek 2016 Mission Grove Pinot Noir (California)
description: This wine might be the best value available in California Pinot Noir. It has great varietal character in the aroma and follows through with tempting spice, red fruit and savory nuances on the palate. Black tea, red cherry and clove waft from the glass while cherry and cranberry spread across the palate, braced by moderate tannins and fresh acidity. It's a beautifully balanced medium-bodied wine.

title: Villa Maria 2015 Cellar Selection Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: Plonk this on the table at just about any dinner party and it's bound to be enjoyed by all. Be it the appealing nose of red-currant jelly, flowers and savory, stony minerality, or the silky, plush-fruited, light-on-its-feet palate, this easy-drinking wine from one of New Zealand's biggest names offers a lot.

title: Villa Maria 2015 Taylors Pass Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: Dried herbs, plums, blueberries, bark and a little dusty oak coalesce in this wine from one of the better known single vineyards in the Awatere Valley. Lean, light and crisp, the palate comes with tart red fruit, more drying herbs and some toasty oak notes on the finish.

title: Williams Selyem 2015 Vista Verde Vineyard Late Harvest Gewürztraminer (San Benito County)
description: Orange blossom, tangerine souffle, light honey and gin-like botanical aromas show on the nose. The palate's concentrated sweetness combines orange zest with lemon cream, making for a nicely complex after-dinner sip.

title: Winzerkeller Andau 2015 Selection Zweigelt (Burgenland)
description: Hints of smoke and mocha clothe the ripe, red cherry fruit on the nose. The mocha notes also color the rounded but still fresh palate with their richness and add a little weight to the midplaate of this fruit-driven wine.

title: Wrath 2015 3 Clone Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Roasted nuts, hot buttered toast with lemon preserves, sea salt and a touch of chalk show on the layered nose of this bottling by winemaker Sabrine Rodems. The flavors are classical and clean, with lemon wedge, cashew, more salt and a hint of butterscotch, all riding atop a strong acidity.

title: Bibbiano 2015  Chianti Classico
description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this bright red opens with aromas of red-skinned berry, violet and eucalyptus. The savory, easygoing palate doles out tart cherry, star anise with a hint of citrus zest alongside fresh acidity and limber tannins. Enjoy through 2019.

title: Black's Station 2015 Malbec (Yolo County)
description: Great structure and vivid fruit flavors make a winning combination in this full-bodied and firmly tannic wine. Powerful but well polished, it has blackberry and dark chocolate flavors, a solid, grippy texture and is nicely dry.
